symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.pattern: Slapped cheek rash (erythema infectiosum) on face, may spread to chest, back, buttocks, arms, and legs; lacy appearance as it fades; itchy; duration 7-10 days, but can last several weeks

symptoms.name: Joint pain (arthralgia)
symptoms.pattern: More common in adults, especially women; affects hands, feet, and knees; bilateral; duration 1-3 weeks, but can last months

symptoms.name: Low blood count (anemia)
symptoms.pattern: In individuals with blood disorders or weakened immune system

lab_values.Hemoglobin: Decreased, especially in individuals with hemoglobinopathies or hemolytic anemias (2-6 g/dL decrease)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with parvovirus B19 infection (e.g., rash, joint pain, flu-like symptoms)
supportive: Positive serologic test for parvovirus B19 IgM antibodies
Detection of parvovirus B19 DNA by PCR
